views.general

Class GeneralView

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.layout.Pane
            • javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane
              • views.general.ParentView
                • views.general.GeneralView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BuildingView, CaveView, SafariView, TownView

    public abstract class GeneralView
extends ParentView
implements java.io.Serializable
    This is the parent for three different views: SafariView, TownView, BuildingView Handles setup and drawing of the maps and the still trainer.
    Author:
    Alan D., Paria K., Samantha F., Rajeev R. Scrum Master: Niven Francis, CSC 335 Final Project
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • GeneralView

        public GeneralView(Trainer trainer)
        All views are constructed upon a Trainer object Creates separate layouts and canvases and items for each view created. Puts handlers for starting and stopping movement with key pressed/released, and handlers for opening up the instructions by holding CTRL Calls all the helper methods to initialize the gridPane, menuButtons, and vBox.
        Parameters:
        trainer - the player in the game

        public void initializeMap(java.lang.Character[][] theMap)

      • drawView

        public void drawView()
        Handles drawing for the view, iterates through the entire grid and draws the images representing the square that the character is representing. Calls getNPC to draw the image associated with the correct NPC for that spot. After drawing the background, calls drawTrainer() to draw the trainer.

      • getNPC

        public NPC getNPC(char npcChar)
        Returns the NPC object representing the spot marked on the grid.
        Parameters:
        npcChar - the corresponding character
        Returns:
        the NPC

      • drawTrainer

        public void drawTrainer()
        Draws the trainer based on the direction they are facing.

      • encounterWildPokemon

        public Pokemon encounterWildPokemon(java.lang.String area)
        The strategy for encountering a wild Pokémon
        Parameters:
        area - the location where the battle is going to start
        Returns:
        the Pokémon that was encountered

      • setInventoryText

        public void setInventoryText()
        Allows the user to see his or her list of inventory items in real time Called by MoveHandler, in pressEnter() when a user picks up an item. Called by MenuHandler when the user opens the inventory or clicks the arrows to navigate their inventory.
